divs: Sighting DetailsI was outside backyard with my son and his friend. Around 9 pm Saturday the 23rd of March. My son was starting a small bon fire.The sky was clear as a bell. Small misty cloud to the south. I sat down facing the East and above my house there was a bright red orange somewhat yellow fireball shaped object. It seemed to just be still. I thought it was a plane at first but it didnt really move. There was no sound. I understand an object coming toward you may appear to be standing still. I watched it for a few minutes. It was large compared to the stars that were out. Very bright. In my backyard we have quite the view of sky. I looked down at the fire for just a couple minutes less then 5 minutes and looked back and it was like it disappeared into thin air. I looked all around in sky especially to the west and found nothing moving, no lights moving. Nothing but the still air and stars. I couldnt stop thinking about it the rest of the night. I recalled a fellow stating two weeks ago described something similar he saw over Bellingham bay and how quickly it moved with no sound.
